member.name: TOKEN_ORIGIN
member.summary: The TOKEN_ORIGIN structure contains information about the origin of the logon session. This structure is used by the function.

member.name: TOKEN_ORIGIN.OriginatingLogonSession
member.summary: Locally unique identifier (LUID) for the logon session. If the token passed to resulted from a logon using explicit credentials, such as passing name, domain, and password to the function, then this member will contain the ID of the logon session that created it. If the token resulted from network authentication, such as a call to , or a call to LogonUser with dwLogonType set to LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK or LOGON32_LOGON_NETWORK_CLEARTEXT, then this member will be zero.
